positions.title: Embedded C/C++/C++11/Python/QML Developer
positions.description:
- Writing high quality C++11, QML code for feature development for Raymarine MFD device running Android operating system. Work involves design, analysis, refactoring, implementation, bug fixing, Squish Testing (Python based automation tool).
- Porting Raymarine SeaTalk2 (STNG) CAN Bus protocol stack (stack implemented fully in C++11) from FreeRTOS/ThreadX to linux.
- Enabling Linux CAN driver in the Raymarine customized Kernel. Identifying kernel patches for CAN driver. Writing/porting Yocto recipe for the Linux CAN driver for integrating the driver into the Kernel.
- Raymarine camera feature development in C/C++. Designing and implementing Automatic Gain Control (AGC) application for Raymarine M300 camera. This typically requires the use of third party SDK (Atlas SDK) for the interface to the PC (for prototyping and testing) and deployment on the Raymarine M300 camera (Intel Apollo Lake processor E3940). The Atlas AGC library runs on the Intel GPU while the hosting software runs on the Intel CPU.
- Customization and cross-compilation and installation of OpenCL run-time for the Intel Platform in Yocto. This includes working with the source code of Intel Graphics Compiler (IGC), Intel Compute Runtime (ICR), Installable Client Driver ICD (OpenCL interface for application development) in Yocto platform.
- Expertise in writing bitbake recipe for integrating application/modules into Yocto build.
- Expertise in developing video frame grabbing, post processing applications using video4Linux driver/OpenCv.
- Developing module for collecting diagnostic information on IPC exchange between the Intel Atom processor and the STM32 micro-controller. The communication happens over 6 UART channels. The diagnostic module gathers statistics on number of CRC errors, Max frame length per channel, total number of frames per channel etc.

positions.title: C++/C++11 Developer at Siemens
positions.description:
• Developed and delivered feature called Compound Image for Siemen’s Intelligent Traffic Systems (ITS) Sicore2 Cameras. Feature tested, and Beta deployed and running successfully without any defect. Development based on OpenCv library v 3.4.3 and C++/C++11.
• Designed and delivered test harness for Compound Image feature. Test harness running in the automated system.
• Developed and delivered feature called Multi-image Evidence for Siemen’s Intelligent Traffic Systems (ITS) Sicore2 Cameras. Feature tested, and Beta deployed and running successfully without any defect. Development based on OpenCv lib v 3.4.3 library and C++/C++11.
• Developed new algorithm for searching image frames from the image source which has significantly enhanced the performance with respect to the earlier legacy algorithm.
• Introduced and implemented exception-based error handling in the Siemens code which has remarkably enhanced the stability of the software stack particularly during software upgrade.
• Introduced and implemented OpenCv call back registering mechanism for better handling of OpenCv exceptions during runtime.
• Helped in porting C++98 legacy to C++11 which has helped in code maintainability, better memory management (introduction of Unique and Shared pointers in the legacy code), introduced STL algorithms to get rid of lengthy complicated algorithm in frame searching.
• Designed and delivered test harness for the Multi-image Evidence feature. Test harness running in the automated system.
• Designing and developing feature called Video Evidence for Siemen’s Intelligent Traffic Systems (ITS) Sicore2 Cameras. Feature tested, and Beta deployed and running successfully without any defect. Development based on OpenCv library and C++/C++11.
• Wrote design and test specification documentation for Compound Image and Multi-image Evidence.

positions.title: Linux Kernel (Wifi Driver) Engineer
positions.description:
- Writing PCIE simulation driver for DTE simulator in linux kernel 3.18 (Maxwell project). Independently developing the DTE simulator kernel module in linux kernel space for running the host Wifi device driver code without the PCIE driver layer and the Wifi Firmware. The simulator can also be run in a desktop environment. It reproduces the functionalities of the PCIE device driver providing the interface layer between the host processor and the Wifi FW. The simulator also simulates the FW functionalities and responds back to the host processor for wifi service start/stop, mlme message handling, network scanning, connecting using the wlan0 interface.
- Writing mlme state machine for parsing mlme messages forwarded by the simulator driver.
- Identified skb packet handling related defects in the Wifi device driver code using the simulator
- Identified bugs in the Wifi driver code causing kernel crash using the simulator.
